intro: Microchilus topoensis, commonly known as the Topoensis mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Viscaraceae. It is native to the cloud forests of South America, particularly in regions of Ecuador and Peru. The plant has small, scale-like leaves and produces tiny, white or yellowish flowers that are often clustered together. It relies on a host tree for water and nutrients, while still performing some photosynthesis. Its unique ecological role makes it an important component of its native ecosystem.
